articles.title: Kemp sentenced to home monitoring for shooting
articles.snippet: Former NBA star Shawn Kemp was sentenced to 30 days of electronic home monitoring for shooting at two men inside a vehicle in a Washington state mall parking lot.

articles.title: S.C. assistant in stable condition after car crash
articles.snippet: South Carolina assistant coach Travian Robertson is hospitalized in stable condition after being involved in a car accident Friday in Chapin, South Carolina, the school said.

articles.title: Bradley: Ryder Cup 'biggest decision' of my life
articles.snippet: Keegan Bradley said Friday he has a "pretty good idea" who his six captain's picks will be for the Ryder Cup.

articles.title: Jays' Bieber stellar in 1st start since April '24
articles.snippet: Shane Bieber struck out nine over six dominant innings of one-run ball in his debut with the Blue Jays and first appearance in 16 months Friday night.

articles.title: Top prospect Chandler debuts with 4-inning save
articles.snippet: Pirates rookie Bubba Chandler, considered the top pitching prospect in baseball, became just the fourth pitcher to record a four-inning save in his major league debut.

articles.title: NCAA 'concerned' by football prediction markets
articles.snippet: The NCAA expressed concern over the lack of guardrails for online prediction markets after financial company Robinhood announced Tuesday that it's allowing trades on the outcome of college football games this season.

articles.title: Ghislaine Maxwell claims in DOJ interview that Epstein list doesn't exist
articles.snippet: Maxwell denied that there is any 'client list' of prominent figures involved in Jeffrey Epstein's crimes.

articles.title: Tough draft-day decisions: Can you pick a top-5 QB and top-3 TE and like your team?
articles.snippet: Daniel Dopp shares takeaways from more than 100 drafts to help you make tough decisions in your upcoming drafts.

articles.title: The best picks for each draft slot in Rounds 1 and 2 in 10-team leagues
articles.snippet: We go through every slot to help you plan ahead and get off to a good start in your draft.

articles.title: Five dead after tour bus crashes on New York highway
articles.snippet: Police say most of the victims are tourists from India, China and the Philippines.

articles.title: England's appetite for destruction undimmed by thrashing of USA
articles.snippet: Ellie Kildunne stole the show, but coach John Mitchell will have been looking more at the inner working of his England team in their World Cup win over the United States.

articles.title: Two games, eight goals conceded - is Potter under pressure?
articles.snippet: With West Ham conceding eight goals in just two games so far this season, the pressure appears to be on manager Graham Potter already.

articles.title: White House announces chipmaker Intel to give US government 10% stake
articles.snippet: President Trump earlier said the company's CEO agreed to the deal in a recent meeting at the White House.

articles.title: Woman jailed for race hate post says she was political prisoner
articles.snippet: She gives her first newspaper interview after being released from prison.

articles.title: Meta partners with Midjourney on AI image and video models
articles.snippet: Meta's chief AI officer said that the company is partnering with Midjourney to license its AI image and video model technology.

articles.title: GB's Caudery 'so ready' for world title bid
articles.snippet: Britain's Molly Caudery says she is "so ready" for a world title bid after her second-place finish in the women's pole vault at the Brussels Diamond League.

articles.title: West Ham booed as Chelsea score five in convincing win
articles.snippet: Joao Pedro gets a goal and an assist as Chelsea come from behind to comfortably beat West Ham 5-1 in the Premier League at London Stadium.

articles.title: Chappell Roan slays Reading Festival with fairytale-themed set
articles.snippet: The US star took to the stage on Friday night, and was almost drowned out by her devoted fans.

articles.title: Raducanu wants Wimbledon to try innovative mixed doubles
articles.snippet: Emma Raducanu says she would like to see Wimbledon follow the US Open's lead in creating an innovative mixed doubles tennis event featuring the sport's superstars.

articles.title: Coinbase CEO explains why he fired engineers who didn’t try AI immediately
articles.snippet: After getting licenses to cover every engineer, some at the cryptocurrency exchange warned Armstrong that adoption would be slow, predicting it would take months to get even half the engineers using AI.

articles.title: Will Serena Williams's weight-loss admission help shed stigma of anti-obesity drugs?
articles.snippet: Could her comments instil a new sense of confidence in those using the drugs and quieten the critics?

articles.title: Bluesky blocks service in Mississippi over age assurance law
articles.snippet: In a blog post published on Friday, the company explains that, as a small team, it doesn't have the resources to make the substantial technical changes this type of law would require, and it raised concerns about the law's broad scope and privacy implications.

articles.title: Fire crush Phoenix to stave off elimination
articles.snippet: Welsh Fire cruise to a comprehensive eight-wicket win over Birmingham Phoenix to keep their fading hopes of reaching The Hundred knockout stages alive.

articles.title: Apple gets ready for AI in the enterprise with new ChatGPT configuration options
articles.snippet: Apple will let businesses configure ChatGPT enterprise access in the fall.

articles.title: How Israel's policies created famine in Gaza
articles.snippet: Israel has systematically obstructed food entering Gaza, aid agencies say, as a UN-backed body confirms a famine.

articles.title: US government plans to take a 10% stake in Intel
articles.snippet: Such federal government ownership of a major corporation would mark a dramatic departure from long-standing U.S. policy.

articles.title: Apple is in talks to use Google’s Gemini for Siri revamp, report says
articles.snippet: Apple promised a major revamp to Siri, but the company's AI capabilities have lagged behind competitors.

articles.title: The next Starship flight will test much more than hardware
articles.snippet: The 10th Starship flight test will be a referendum on the company's build-fly-fix approach.

articles.title: 'Biggest event in sport' - Trump says Washington to host 2026 World Cup draw
articles.snippet: The draw for the 2026 men's World Cup will take place in Washington this December, US President Donald Trump has announced.

articles.title: Brewdog co-founder leaves craft beer giant
articles.snippet: Martin Dickie, who founded the Ellon-based firm with James Watt in 2007, announced his decision in an email to staff.

articles.title: Famine in Gaza City is 'failure of humanity', UN chief says
articles.snippet: A UN-backed body confirms famine in Gaza City and surrounding areas, and says half a million are facing "catastrophic" conditions.

articles.title: Fed chair Powell boosts expectation of US rate cut
articles.snippet: Jerome Powell appeared to back a cut to borrowing rates and played down long term inflation risks in his annual speech at Jackson Hole.

articles.title: Transfer tension as Nuno faces uncertain Forest future
articles.snippet: Nuno Espirito Santo's future as Nottingham Forest manager is uncertain after a breakdown in his relationship with owner Evangelos Marinakis.

articles.title: Royal Mail and DHL halt some US deliveries over tariffs
articles.snippet: Services including Royal Mail and  DHL say they are suspending deliveries until they have proper systems in place.

articles.title: Revolution Beauty to 'reset' after sale falls through
articles.snippet: Co-founders Adam Minto and Tom Allsworth will return to the troubled brand after plummeting sales.

articles.title: Apple TV+ raises subscription prices worldwide, including in UK
articles.snippet: The streaming industry has seen a series of price hikes from its major players in the past year.

articles.title: TikTok to lay off hundreds of UK content moderators
articles.snippet: The firm says it's planning to relocate work to its other offices in Europe and invest more in AI.

articles.title: UK's third-largest steelworks collapses into government control
articles.snippet: Hundreds of Liberty Steel workers in Rotherham and Sheffield face an uncertain future.

articles.title: Elon Musk and X reach settlement with axed Twitter workers
articles.snippet: Ex-Twitter staff sued the platform after some 6,000 employees were sacked in 2022.
